result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan M Mcguffey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine, costs, & DNA surcharges within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Megan M Mcguffey in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM481 and 16CM121.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM481 Count 1: No Contest
16CM121: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15 CM481 Ct 1 and 16CM121.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CM481 count 2 is dismissed & read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler conurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:***
15CM481 Count 1: $10 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $475.60  60 days to pay or set up payment plan.
Provide DNA Sample.

16CM121: $10 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $465.60  60 days to pay or set up payment plan.

ADDRESS INFO for Megan M Mcguffey
Current: 240 Kahoun Road, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2016)
Prior: 500 25th Street North, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States
Plea hearing on May 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.
